text: You don’t have to control your thoughts. You just have to stop letting them control you.
author: Dan Millman

text: Happiness can be found even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: What mental health needs is more sunlight, more candor, and more unashamed conversation.
author: Glenn Close

text: Your present circumstances don’t determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start.
author: Nido Qubein

text: Healing takes time, and asking for help is a courageous step.
author: Mariska Hargitay

text: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
author: Helen Keller

text: Do not judge me by my success, judge me by how many times I fell and got back up again.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Out of difficulties grow miracles.
author: Jean de La Bruyère

text: You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it.
author: Margaret Thatcher

text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

text: Once you choose hope, anything’s possible.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Stars can’t shine without darkness.
author: D.H. Sidebottom

text: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
author: Buddha

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Talk to yourself like you would to someone you love.
author: Brené Brown

text: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Self-care is how you take your power back.
author: Lalah Delia

text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Courage doesn’t always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, ‘I will try again tomorrow.’
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

text: It is not the load that breaks you down, it’s the way you carry it.
author: Lou Holtz

text: Promise me you’ll always remember: you’re braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: A.A. Milne

text: Sometimes the people around you won’t understand your journey. They don’t need to, it’s not for them.
author: Joubert Botha

text: Rest when you’re weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.
author: Ralph Marston

text: Self-care is giving the world the best of you, instead of what’s left of you.
author: Katie Reed

text: Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.
author: Anne Lamott

text: Your illness does not define you. Your strength and courage does.
author: Unknown

text: It’s not stress that kills us, it is our reaction to it.
author: Hans Selye

text: Every day begins with an act of courage and hope: getting out of bed.
author: Mason Cooley

text: If you get tired, learn to rest, not to quit.
author: Banksy

text: Keep good company, read good books, love good things, and cultivate soul and body as faithfully as you can.
author: Louisa May Alcott

text: Self-compassion is simply giving the same kindness to ourselves that we would give to others.
author: Christopher Germer

text: Not until we are lost do we begin to understand ourselves.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: Mental health… is not a destination, but a process. It’s about how you drive, not where you’re going.
author: Noam Shpancer

text: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
author: William James

text: There is hope, even when your brain tells you there isn’t.
author: John Green

text: Don’t let your struggle become your identity.
author: Unknown

text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Do not lose hope, please believe that there are a thousand beautiful things waiting for you.
author: Unknown

text: Nothing can dim the light that shines from within.
author: Maya Angelou

text: If you want to fly, give up everything that weighs you down.
author: Buddha

text: You are allowed to be both a masterpiece and a work in progress simultaneously.
author: Sophia Bush

text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Every day may not be good, but there is something good in every day.
author: Alice Morse Earle

text: You are stronger than you think.
author: Unknown

text: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

text: Take rest; a field that has rested gives a bountiful crop.
author: Ovid

text: Self-love, self-respect, self-worth: there’s a reason they all start with ‘self.’ You can’t find them in anyone else.
author: Unknown

text: This too shall pass.
author: Persian Proverb

text: The only journey is the journey within.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

text: Lighten up on yourself. No one is perfect. Gently accept your humanness.
author: Deborah Day

text: It’s okay to not be okay as long as you are not giving up.
author: Karen Salmansohn

text: Don’t wait until you’ve reached your goal to be proud of yourself. Be proud of every step you take.
author: Unknown

text: Be patient with yourself, nothing in nature blooms all year.
author: Unknown

text: Healing is not linear.
author: Unknown

text: Sometimes the smallest step in the right direction ends up being the biggest step of your life.
author: Naeem Callaway

text: Happiness is letting go of what you think your life is supposed to look like.
author: Unknown

text: When you can’t find the sunshine, be the sunshine.
author: Unknown

text: You don’t always need a plan. Sometimes you just need to breathe, trust, let go, and see what happens.
author: Mandy Hale

text: It’s not whether you get knocked down, it’s whether you get up.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: You are enough just as you are.
author: Meghan Markle

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

text: Be gentle with yourself. You’re doing the best you can.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Your potential is endless.
author: Unknown

text: You are not your illness. You have an individual story to tell.
author: Julian Seifter

text: Give yourself the same care and attention that you give to others and watch yourself bloom.
author: Unknown

text: Every storm runs out of rain.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Happiness is a choice, not a result.
author: Ralph Marston

text: One small crack does not mean you are broken, it means you were put to the test and you didn’t fall apart.
author: Linda Poindexter

text: No amount of anxiety can change the future. No amount of regret can change the past.
author: Karen Salmansohn

text: Healing begins with acceptance.
author: Unknown

text: You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Tough times never last, but tough people do.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: The sun himself is weak when he first rises, and gathers strength and courage as the day gets on.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Be kind to yourself, you are doing the best you can.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t compare your beginning to someone else’s middle.
author: Jon Acuff

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Inner peace begins the moment you choose not to allow another person or event to control your emotions.
author: Pema Chödrön

text: Never give up on someone with a mental illness. When 'I' is replaced by 'We,' illness becomes wellness.
author: Shannon L. Alder

text: Healing requires from us to stop struggling, but to enjoy life more and endure it less.
author: Darina Stoyanova

text: Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living, and your belief will help create the fact.
author: William James

text: Take a deep breath. It’s just a bad day, not a bad life.
author: Unknown

text: Owning our story and loving ourselves through that process is the bravest thing we’ll ever do.
author: Brené Brown
